With this, Andhra Pradesh's two main political parties, YSRCP and TDP, have declared to support Murmu.

351.title: Over 3,000 people evacuated amid heavy rains in Gujarat: Officials
351.article_body: Over 3,000 people have been evacuated from Gujarat as heavy rains lashed the state and the meteorological department's forecast showed that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely to continue over the next five days in several districts. Officials said that 400 people have been evacuated from Chhotaudepur, which received 433 mm of rainfall in just 12 hours.

352.title: Who is Sneha Pareek, the only girl JEE Main 2022 topper who scored 300/300?
352.article_body: Out of the 14 students who scored 100 percentile in JEE Main 2022 Session 1, Guwahati’s Sneha Pareek is the only girl topper who scored 300/300. She wants to pursue BTech in Computer Science. "I'm willing to join any IIT that offers my desired course. If it comes as a preferred choice, I will opt for IIT-Bombay," she said.

353.title: 'Dhaakad' was removed from cinemas even before I could watch it: Saswata
353.article_body: Saswata Chatterjee, who was recently seen in Kangana Ranaut-fronted 'Dhaakad', has said he fails to understand why the movie didn't work. "It was a big project. It was removed from [cinemas]...even before I could watch it," he added. 'Dhaakad', which was made on an estimated budget of ₹85 crore, managed to earn only ₹2.58 crore in India, according to reports.

354.title: Abe killed by ex-serviceman, BJP playing with fire on Agnipath: TMC
354.article_body: The TMC has cautioned Centre over new military recruitment scheme Agnipath by pointing out that ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated by a short-service ex-serviceman. "BJP is playing with fire in the name of Agnipath...We have seen what...happened in Japan," TMC's Kunal Ghosh said. Abe's attacker reportedly lost his job in Japanese Maritime Self-Defence Force after three years of service.

355.title: Rupee closes at new all-time low of 79.44 against US dollar
355.article_body: The rupee ended at a new all-time low of nearly 79.44 per US dollar on Monday. The currency on Monday opened at 79.30 against the US dollar and witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24 and a low of 79.49. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex ended 86.61 points lower at 54,395.23, while NSE Nifty declined 4.60 points on Monday.

356.title: IFS officer shares video of cobra hiding in a shoe, says 'be careful in monsoon'
356.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda has shared a video of a cobra hiding inside a shoe and tweeted, "You will find them at oddest possible places in monsoons. Be careful. Take help of trained personnel." The video showed the snake being rescued by a trained official, who advised people to always shake their shoes before wearing.

357.title: We weren't prepared for animal that it was: Ranbir on Brahmastra getting delayed
357.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, while speaking about the delay in the release of 'Brahmastra', said, "I think when we started...[it], we weren't prepared for the animal that it was." "It had too many special effects...and where the story was, we didn't expect that...So we were learning as we were making it," he added. The film is scheduled to release on September 9.

358.title: Anil to host a Bohemian-themed baby shower for Sonam Kapoor: Report
358.article_body: Anil Kapoor and Sunita Kapoor will be hosting a  Bohemian-themed baby shower for their daughter Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, according to a report. The actress is expecting her first child with her husband Anand Ahuja. The baby shower will reportedly be hosted at Sunita's sister Kavita Singh's Rockdale mansion in Bandra, where Sonam and Anand Ahuja got married.

359.title: Vauld's users to continue earning interest on crypto FDs: CEO
359.article_body: Crypto lending platform Vauld's users will continue to earn interest on their fixed crypto deposits, its CEO Darshan Bathija confirmed. Bathija's clarification comes after the company suspended withdrawals and deposits citing volatile conditions in the crypto market. On resuming withdrawal deposit options, he said he can't provide fixed timelines yet but is working to resume operations soon.

360.title: 5-yr-old Mumbai boy falls to death from window of 11th-floor-flat
360.article_body: A five-year-old boy fell from the window of his 11th floor flat in a housing society in Mumbai's Byculla area on Sunday while he was playing with an umbrella, police said. The boy was near his bed and his mother and relatives were in the same room when the incident occurred in the morning, an official said.

361.title: Journalists barred from entering Odisha schools, Education Min criticises move
361.article_body: The Odisha government banned the entry of journalists into schools in some areas after news channels showed how students were poor in mathematics. Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticised the move, saying the press is the fourth pillar of democracy and cannot be stopped from entering a public institution. The news channels showed class 5 students unable to recollect tables.

362.title: 'Stay single like me', says Nagaland minister on World Population Day; tweet viral
362.article_body: Nagaland's Higher Education and Tribal Affairs Minister Temjen Along's tweet on World Population Day has gone viral. "Let's be sensible towards the issues of population growth and inculcate informed choices on childbearing," said Along, adding, "Or #StaySingle like me and together we can contribute towards a sustainable future." Along's speech on 'benefits of small eyes' had earlier gone viral.

363.title: Goa Congress MLAs being offered ₹50 cr by BJP to join party: Siddaramaiah
363.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah alleged that BJP is offering ₹50 crores to Goa Congress MLAs and said that by doing this they (BJP) are not believing in democracy. "Not only in Goa, everywhere they do Operation Kamala. They will offer money, they will purchase MLAs," the Congress leader said. It's not possible for BJP to do this in Karnataka, he added.

364.title: Sri Lankan PM holds Cabinet meeting as PMO confirms Prez's resignation
364.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe held a Cabinet meeting with all the ministers at the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) on Monday, the PM's media unit said. It added that all ministers maintained that they'll hand over their responsibilities "as soon as there's an agreement to form an All-Party Government". This comes as Sri Lanka's PMO officially confirmed the President's resignation.

365.title: 94-yr-old Bhagwani wins 1 gold, 2 bronze medals at 2022 World Masters Athletics C'ships
365.article_body: Bhagwani Devi Dagar, a 94-year-old woman from India, bagged a gold medal and two bronze medals at the World Masters Athletics Championships 2022. The Indian athlete won the gold medal in the 100-metre sprint event, which she ran in 24.74 seconds. She bagged one of her two bronze medals in shot put.

366.title: Modi is weakest PM; 'undeclared emergency' under his rule: CM KCR
366.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said that PM Narendra Modi is the weakest and most inefficient Indian PM of all time. CM Rao also said that there is an "undeclared Emergency" in India under PM Modi's rule. "During the Congress rule, there was brain-drain. Now, with BJP's policies, there is a capital drain, resulting in depleting forex reserves," he added.

367.title: Police seizes truck carrying gutkha worth ₹91 lakh in Pune
367.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police intercepted a truck carrying banned gutkha worth ₹91 lakh at the Pune-Nashik highway on Sunday. The officials of the Chakan Police Station arrested the truck driver, Ganesh Bhadale (32), by laying a trap in the Waki Khurd area. Notably, since 2020, the Pimpri Chinchwad Police have seized gutkha and paan masala products worth over ₹10 crores.

368.title: UP man on Interpol's 'red notice' arrested at Delhi's IGI airport
368.article_body: Noida Police's Special Task Force arrested a UP man, who had been missing for eight years and had been on Interpol's 'red notice' from Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Sunday, officials said. The accused had killed a man and robbed his motorcycle in 2013. According to police, he got a fake passport in 2016 and escaped to Saudi Arabia.

369.title: Kohli shouldn't be dropped, he can single-handedly win you WC: Sarandeep
369.article_body: Ex-Team India selector Sarandeep Singh has said Virat Kohli shouldn't be dropped from India's T20I squad ahead of the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Everybody knows his capabilities and his potential. He can single-handedly win you World Cup," he stated. Sarandeep also questioned the rest being given to Kohli, stating that playing is the only way to get back to form.

370.title: Quite a few brilliant shots: Tendulkar on Suryakumar's 117 in Nottingham
370.article_body: Praising India batter Suryakumar Yadav following his ton in the third T20I against England in Nottingham, Sachin Tendulkar said, "Amazing hundred." He tweeted, "There were quite a few brilliant shots but those scoop sixes over point were just spectacular." Suryakumar scored 117 runs off 55 deliveries. It was Suryakumar's maiden T20I century. England beat India by 17 runs.

371.title: 2 terrorists, including top JeM commander, killed in J&K's Awantipora
371.article_body: At least two terrorists belonging to terror group Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Awantipora on Monday. One of the terrorists has been identified as top JeM commander Kaiser Koka while the identity of the other is being ascertained, police said. Incriminating materials, arms and ammunition including a US-made rifle among others have been recovered.

372.title: Ex-Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains surrenders before court in rape case
372.article_body: Former Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains on Monday surrendered before a court in Punjab's Ludhiana in connection with a rape case, Joint Commissioner Ravcharan Singh Brar has confirmed. Police took custody of Simarjeet, whose younger brother Karamjit Singh Bains and aide Sukhchain Singh are already in jail in the case.

373.title: I had tested for Dayaben's role, not sure I'm doing it: Aishwarya
373.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Sakhuja has stated that she had tested for the role of Dayaben for the television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', adding that she doesn't think she is doing it. The makers of the show had confirmed that the character will be returning to the show but actress Disha Vakani will not be portraying her.

374.title: It won't be easy for Pakistan to beat India this time: Shoaib Akhtar
374.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said it won't be "easy" for the Babar Azam-led side to beat Team India in the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "India will come up with proper planning this time around," he stated. Pakistan had defeated India by 10 wickets in the 2021 T20 World Cup in UAE.

375.title: Biotech startup String Bio raises $20 mn in Series B funding round
375.article_body: Biotech startup String Bio raised $20 million in its Series B funding round from Woodside Energy, Ankur Capital, Dare Ventures, Redstart and Zenfold Ventures. The Bengaluru-based startup has also signed an agreement with Australia's Woodside Energy for producing sustainable protein ingredients from greenhouse gases. The company uses biotechnology to produce animal feed and food ingredients.

376.title: It was physically exhausting: Nora on directing song 'Dirty Little Secret'
376.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi, who turned director and choreographer for her international single 'Dirty Little Secret', opened up about the challenges of being behind the camera. Nora said, "It requires...lot of pre-planning." "It was physically exhausting, especially the last day of the shoot. We shot for around 20 hours. [I had to make sure]...the dancers were in sync," she added.

377.title: Panneerselvam's supporters slap slippers at Palaniswami's photo in Chennai
377.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam’s supporters slapped slippers at Edappadi K Palaniswami’s photo as they protested AIADMK’s General Council meeting in Vanagaram, Chennai on Monday. Panneerselvam was expelled from all posts of AIADMK after Palaniswami took control of party as its interim General Secretary. Earlier today, supporters of both leaders clashed near party’s headquarters in Chennai.

378.title: 24 gamblers detained in Bengaluru, over ₹2.5 lakh cash seized
378.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) in Bengaluru detained 24 gamblers in the city and seized over ₹2.5 lakh in cash from their possession. The gambling games were organised in Vidyaranyapura and Halasuru Gate police station areas. Last week, the Crime Branch arrested three people for selling drugs and seized items worth ₹83 lakh from the accused.

379.title: Razorpay, Pine Labs among 1st firms to get RBI's payment aggregator, gateway licences
379.article_body: Online payment providers Razorpay and Pine Labs are among the first companies to receive in-principle approval from RBI for payment aggregator (PA) and payment gateway (PG) licences. The RBI has asked the companies to conduct an audit within the next six months for final approval. Companies like BharatPe, PhonePe and Amazon, among others, too applied for the licences.

380.title: Can't allow mindset of 1 person having 10 children: Giriraj Singh
380.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh said that there is an urgent need for a stringent law on population control. "We have limited resources. Our population is expanding like the mouth of Sursa (mythical female demon)," Giriraj said on the occasion of World Population Day. He added, "The perverse mindset out of which one person sires 10 children can not be allowed."

381.title: BJP Mahila Morcha member dies by suicide in Kerala, blames BJP leader
381.article_body: A BJP Mahila Morcha member died by suicide after hanging herself in her house in Kerala's Palakkad and blamed a local BJP leader in her suicide note, police said. Her brother spoke to a TV channel saying that the leader used her, adding other women are in the same situation. An FIR has been filed and probe has been launched.

382.title: Decomposed body of 21-yr-old woman found inside sack in Gr Noida
382.article_body: A 21-year-old woman's decomposed body was found stuffed and tied inside a sack in a house in Greater Noida's Sector Gamma 1 on Saturday night. The deceased, Pooja Bharti, hailed from Bihar and was reportedly preparing for a government job exam. According to police, Bharti was sharing the flat with a man, who is absconding since her body was found.

383.title: Hemsworth's 'Thor: Love and Thunder' earns ₹64.80 cr in 4 days in India
383.article_body: Chris Hemsworth-starrer 'Thor: Love and Thunder' has earned ₹64.80 crore in India within four days of its release. Film trade analyst Taran Adarsh took to Twitter to share the box office figures of the Taika Waititi directorial, writing that it earned ₹18.20 crore on Thursday and collected ₹11.40 crore, ₹16.80 crore, ₹18.40 crore on Friday, Saturday and Sunday respectively.

384.title: Kerala Minister R Bindu donates gold bangle for kidney patient's treatment
384.article_body: Kerala Minister R Bindu has donated one of her gold bangles for the treatment of a kidney patient who has to undergo transplant. Bindu was attending a meeting in Irinjalakuda area of Thrissur district of a medical aid committee for kidney transplantation and removed one of her bangles to give it as first donation for the patient's treatment.

385.title: India's inflation likely held steady just above 7% in June: Poll
385.article_body: India's retail inflation likely held steady just above 7% in June, a Reuters poll found. The poll of 42 economists showed inflation, as measured by the consumer price index (CPI), was steady at an annual 7.03% in June, as compared to 7.04% in May. Forecasts for the data, due on July 12, ranged from 6.45% to 7.70%.

386.title: 14 students score 100 percentile in JEE Main session 1, Sneha Pareek only girl topper
386.article_body: Fourteen students have scored perfect 100 percentile in JEE Main 2022 session 1. Notably, Sneha Pareek from Assam is the only girl topper. The other toppers are Jasti Yashwanth VVS, Aniket Chattopadhyay, Dheeraj Kurukunda, Rupesh Biyani, Koyyana Suhas, Penikalapati Ravi Kishore, Polisetty Karthikeya, Kushagra Srivastava, Mrinal Garg, Sarthak Maheshwari, Navya, Boya Haren Sathvik and Saumitra Garg.

387.title: Zubair sent to 14-day judicial custody by UP court for allegedly sharing false news
387.article_body: Fact-checker Mohammed Zubair was remanded to 14-day judicial custody by a Lakhimpur Kheri court in UP on Monday, days after Supreme Court granted him five-day bail. Zubair has been remanded in a case that was filed last year. A local TV journalist had lodged a police complaint alleging that Zubair circulated false news to disturb communal harmony.

388.title: IMF made us dance to its tune but hasn't released $6 bn loan: Pak minister
388.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah said that the IMF hasn't released the tranche of the $6 billion bailout package even though it made the country "dance to its tune". Sanaullah said that the country is currently going through a difficult situation in terms of its economy and the government had accepted the IMF terms which they "weren't in favour of".

389.title: Transgender, 9 others booked for attacking female YouTuber in Pune
389.article_body: A transgender person has been booked along with at least nine other people in Pune for alleged attempted assault on a woman who runs a YouTube channel, officials said on Sunday. The primary accused has been identified as Sagar Popat Shinde alias Shivlaxmi Zalte. The accused persons allegedly attacked the woman, accusing her of spreading false information about them.

390.title: Sri Lankan Prez orders 'smooth' distribution of LPG amid protests
390.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has ordered officials to ensure the "smooth" distribution of 3,700 metric tonnes of LPG received by the country, his office said on Sunday. This comes as the country is facing a shortage of fuel amid a worsening economic crisis. Rajapaksa's location is unknown since protesters entered his office and official residence.

391.title: I was molested by my cousins in India while growing up: Singer-actress Monica Dogra
391.article_body: In a recent interview where she talked about being pansexual, Indian-American singer-actress Monica Dogra revealed she was molested by her cousins in India while growing up. Dogra added she was also touched inappropriately by a family friend in her sleep. While talking about her sexuality, she said, "Growing up, I was ashamed of my gender for the most part."

392.title: Every minute Biden is late, he'll get 1 less minute with me: Uber ex-CEO in leaked 2016 text
392.article_body: Uber's ex-CEO Travis Kalanick's text to a colleague in 2016, after then-US Vice President Joe Biden was late to a meeting with him, has surfaced as part of the leaked documents obtained by The Guardian. "I've had my people let him know that every minute late he is, is one less minute he'll have with me," Kalanick's text message read.

393.title: Usman Khawaja mocks Kapil Dev's 'bench Kohli in T20Is' remark, says 'Australia agrees'
393.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja mocked ex-India captain Kapil Dev's 'bench Virat Kohli in T20Is' remark.  "Averages 50 at almost 140 [strike rate]. Good call. Australia agrees," wrote Khawaja with a couple of 'tears of laughter' emojis. Khawaja was responding to ICC's post on Instagram wherein Kapil suggested that Kohli's reputation shouldn't decide his place in the side.

394.title: Pic of 500-million-year-old fossilised brain of 3-eyed predator released
394.article_body: The fossilised brain of a creature with three eyes, that lived 500 million years ago is being studied by scientists. Pictures of the remains of the brain and nerves of the marine predator called Stanleycaris have been released. "The details are so clear it's as if we're looking at an animal that died yesterday," said a researcher on the fossil.

395.title: Was left speechless by some of his shots: Reece Topley on Suryakumar
395.article_body: England pacer Reece Topley, who was named 'Player of the Match' for his performance in the third T20I against India, has said he was left speechless by some of Suryakumar Yadav's shots during his 117-run innings in the game. "[It] was an unbelievable knock from the Indian side," he added. Suryakumar slammed 14 fours and 6 sixes in his innings.

396.title: IIT graduates' startup Vegrow raises $25 mn in Series B round
396.article_body: Founded by IIT alumni, B2B marketplace Vegrow, has raised $25 million in its Series B funding round. The round was led by Prosus Ventures and saw participation from existing investors Matrix Partners India, Elevation Capital, Lightspeed Venture Partners and Ankur Capital. The startup helps bridge the demand and supply for fruits by bringing buyers and traders on a singular platform.

397.title: India is playing a big role for Sri Lanka: Jayasuriya amid economic crisis
397.article_body: Amid economic and political crisis in Sri Lanka, former cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya said that India is playing a big role for the country. "India, being very helpful from the start of crisis, has given aide. We are thankful," he added. India earlier said that it has extended this year itself "an unprecedented support of over $3.8 billion" to Sri Lanka.

398.title: Ignored cartilage tear for 1.5 yrs, I've stress fracture now: Vivek Agnihotri
398.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director, Vivek Agnihotri, has opened up about the cartilage tear in his knee. The filmmaker said he has finally started his knee therapy after suffering the injury last year. Sharing a picture of his bandaged knee, Vivek wrote on Twitter, "Finally, knee therapy begins. Fully ignored Meniscus (cartilage tear) for 1.5 yrs...Now I also have stress fracture."

399.title: 'Avengers: Endgame' directors to visit India for 'The Gray Man' premiere
399.article_body: Director duo Joe and Anthony Russo, aka Russo Brothers, will be in India for the premiere of their upcoming film 'The Gray Man'. The filmmakers, known for 'Avengers: Infinity War' and 'Avengers: Endgame', will be joining Dhanush for the premiere in Mumbai. In a video message, Joe and Anthony said, "We're so excited to be coming to India...see you soon."

400.title: 2nd seeds Krejcikova and Siniakova win 2nd Wimbledon women's doubles title
400.article_body: Second seeds Barbora Krejcikova and Katerina Siniakova won their second Wimbledon doubles title after beating top seeds Elise Mertens and Shuai Zhang 6-2, 6-4 on Sunday. It was the Czech pair's fifth Grand Slam doubles title and second this year. They won the Australian Open in January. Krejcikova and Siniakova won their first Wimbledon in 2018.

401.title: Disqualify MLAs Michael Lobo, Digambar Kamat: Goa Congress to Speaker
401.article_body: The Goa Congress has petitioned the Speaker of the Assembly to disqualify its MLAs Digambar Kamat and Michael Lobo under the anti-defection law. Earlier on Sunday, it removed Lobo as the Leader of Opposition and claimed that a conspiracy was hatched by some of its own leaders with BJP. Reacting to the allegations, Kamat said he was "shocked and stunned".

402.title: Rain lashes several parts of Delhi after a hot & humid day
402.article_body: Parts of Delhi, including India Gate and ITO areas, received rainfall on Monday after a hot and humid day. The weather department has predicted thunderstorms accompanied by light to moderate intensity rain in the national capital. The Delhi Traffic Police took to Twitter to alert people and advised commuters to plan their journey accordingly.

403.title: Suryakumar will be part of India's playing XI for T20 WC: Piyush Chawla
403.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla has said Suryakumar Yadav will definitely be part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "100 per cent (he will be part of the squad). We all know what he can do in the middle-order...he just walks into the playing XI," stated Chawla. Suryakumar smashed his maiden T20I hundred against England on Sunday.

404.title: She's wonderful, I'm glad: Vaani Kapoor on comparison with Katrina Kaif
404.article_body: Reacting to her 'Shamshera' character being compared to Katrina Kaif's role in 'Thugs of Hindostan', actress Vaani Kapoor said that the former is wonderful. "I'm glad. If you're comparing me, please compare me to her beauty," she added. The actress further said that her part in 'Shamshera' is written in a different way and both films are very different.
